posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked:
I have a rather old phone with limited storage. After using Signal for a long period it is close to using all my memory.
I think that deleting all media from a thread (group) is essential to be able to use Signal in the long run, because I need to free up storage.
I didn’t want to create a new issue, or bump an existing issue for this, but for me this is a critical feature request.
See also:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Signal uses too much data on storage / can't clear data with signal

opened 07:50PM - 30 May 16 UTC
closed 12:00AM - 03 Apr 18 UTC
peterpanondrugs
help wanted

<!-- This is a bug report template. By following the instructions below and fill…ing out the sections with your information, you will help the developers to get all the necessary data to fix your issue. You can also preview your report before submitting it. You may remove sections that aren't relevant to your particular case. Before we begin, please note that this tracker is only for issues, not questions or comments. If you are looking for support, please see our support center instead: http://support.whispersystems.org/ or email support@whispersystems.org Let's begin with a checklist: replace the empty checkboxes [ ] below with checked ones [x] accordingly --> I have: - [x] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] read https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports --- ### Bug description Signal uses too much data on storage. ### Steps to reproduce - Send videos pictures whatever with a fresh install. - delete all chats. for group chats handle like this: clean completly from inside the group. - data wont drop on install size. e.g. with 2 group chats (1st: 4user; 2nd: 10 user), Signal consumes 187MB in Total! - i checked for empty signal download folders "movies" and "pictures" - 3-4 days ago i cleared (clear data) a total empty signal (same 2 groups) with storage use of 1,38GB! these days later: im back on 187MB. **Actual result:** maybe the group chats need that much storage??? i dont hope so! **Expected result:** When i delete all like my describtion above, signal should drop on install size. (correct me if im wrong, but 150MB for 2 emtpy group chats is too much) ### Screenshots ![d4bee971-3f6f-4cf0-86ab-3e3803ed2d0f](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8776733/15657342/4083d64c-26b0-11e6-975d-0fbf0419209b.png) ### Device info **Device:** S3 LTE (Intl.) **Android version:** 5.1.1 **Signal version:** 3.16.0 ### Link to debug log https://gist.github.com/01a0bdc4fa5671bb4e4635e586d04264

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Allow removing attachments

opened 06:07PM - 12 Oct 15 UTC
closed 09:59PM - 02 Apr 18 UTC
johannesjh
feature

Please add the possibility of deleting attachments from received and sent messag…es. This functionality would benefit usage on devices with limited storage capacity. E.g., my personal situation is that the many pictures and videos I receive are filling up my precious storage space. I would like to delete the pictures but keep the message texts. (Also compare #4065 for a related request to allow storing messages on the external SD card).

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

[Feature request] Add ability to delete image in image view

opened 05:28PM - 26 Mar 15 UTC
closed 09:32PM - 02 Apr 18 UTC
BT80
feature

Currently the only way to delete an image is by long-tapping the image and selec…ting the delete icon. If you short-tap the image it is displayed in full screen mode. There is already a save icon in that view. My suggestion is to also add a delete icon in that view.

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Wishlist: Possibility to delete images in gallery mode (and when opened)

opened 09:29AM - 27 Jan 17 UTC
closed 01:10AM - 03 Apr 18 UTC
mawed
feature

I have: - [X] searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [X] read https:…//github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports ---------------------------------------- ### Feature description When opening "Image gallery" (or lateron media gallery due to #5941) I would like to be able to multiselect images/media and delete them. And when opening an image/media, I would like to have the possibility to delete it in this opened view. Maybe putting this option behind a settings menu as the action bar already contains forward, save, All Images. (In Gallery mode only save). IMO there should be a dialog, if you really want to delete this (all the selected images). --- ~One point to think about is the corresponding messaged (text). At the moment, it's only possible to delete the whole messagte (text + image/media) by selecting it right in the conversation. When deleting in the gallery mode or when opened, the corresponding text is not visible to the user, so maybe it should be contained (with a hint to the deleted image/media)?~[Edit: Duplicate of #4242]

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Install TextSecure on external SD card?

opened 04:23PM - 12 Sep 15 UTC
closed 09:50PM - 02 Apr 18 UTC
apmon

There are some devices with very limited resources, particularly with limited in…ternal storage where even the comparatively modest storage requirements of TextSecure can be an issue. Would it be possible for TextSecure to be installed on external SD card for those that have one? It looks like all that is necessary to allow this is to add a line in the AndroidManifest.xml [1]. [1] http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/manifest-element.html#install

posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked:
There is a pull request in place that implements the batch media deletion feature: Allow deleting attachments from media overview by haffenloher · Pull Request #6165 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
Is there anything I can do to speed up the acceptance of this pull request? Like testing or providing feedback on the pull request?
Currently Signal is using so much of my phone memory that I cannot update any apps anymore, so easy deletion of media is an urgent issue for me.

link_counts.title: Allow deleting attachments from media overview by haffenloher · Pull Request #6165 · WhisperSystems/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.cooked:
janvlug:

Is there anything I can do to speed up the acceptance of this pull request? Like testing or providing feedback on the pull request?

If you want to do code review, go ahead. I still need to find the time to rebase it (and some other PRs as well) - maybe I can get it done this weekend.

off topic:
thanks @haffenloher for your PRs! Although this and also the resend button PR are still not merged. Looking forward to them being implemented and appreciate all your contributions.

posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked: Today, another Signal contact announced to uninstall Signal because of to it’s huge memory usage. It’s a pity to see long time Signal converts leaving Signal now they are running out of memory.

Did you already try enabling the option to shorten the number of messages per conversation? It’s in settings -> chats and media -> message trimming.
This should also delete the according media files and maybe free some space.

posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked: Before I had time to respond with that suggestion, my contact already uninstalled Signal. However, this freed up so much space that my contact has reinstalled Signal now again.

link_counts.title: What's your most-missed-feature-ranking?

posts.name: Jan
posts.cooked:
Another Signal contact has the plan to remove Signal because of the amount of used storage. I gave the suggestion to use message trimming. But I see a trend of persons removing Signal because of the amount of storage used.

My phone memory is also nearly completely filled by Signal. I really do not want to delete all my media, so next to deleting media, batch exporting all media or all media of a conversation is needed. This functionality was there in the past, but it has been removed.

Safely installing Signal on the SDCard would also be a good option. Will this option be possible with the migration to the new encrypted database?

link_counts.title: Cannot export media anymore · Issue #7097 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.cooked:
They are working on this issue:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Allow deletion of media through preview.

signalapp:4.18.0 ← signalapp:greyson/delete-single-media
opened 06:19AM - 14 Mar 18 UTC
greyson-signal
+162 -28

Added the ability to delete media via the media preview. A delete option is adde…d to the action bar of the MediaPreviewActivity. When pressed: * The attachment entry representing the media is deleted. * If there are no other attachments for the linked MMS message, then the MMS entry is also deleted. * The preview is closed. [Video](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/files/1809293/delete-media-preview.zip) **TODO** - [x] Verify files are physically removed from the disk. **Test Cases** * Deleted static image * Deleted GIF * Deleted video * Ensured that messages are gone from the conversation view. * Ensured that media is gone from the "all media" screen. * Ensured that the delete option is not present for previews of unsent media. * Simulated the DeleteMediaTask taking a long time, so the preview closes before the deletion is finished. The conversation is updated when the message is deleted. * Ensured that if you open the preview from the "all media" screen and then delete it, the "all media" screen is updated to reflect that. **Unable to Test** * Deleting one attachment from a message with multiple attachments. While this is technically possible, there's no way to create this scenario in the app today. **Test Devices** * [Moto X (2nd Generation), Android 6.0](https://www.gsmarena.com/motorola_moto_x_(2nd_gen)-6649.php) * [Moto E (2nd Generation), Android 5.1](https://www.gsmarena.com/motorola_moto_e_(2nd_gen)-6986.php) * [Galaxy S3 Mini, Andoid 4.2.2](https://www.gsmarena.com/samsung_i8200_galaxy_s_iii_mini_ve-6190.php) **Follow-Up Tasks** * Add a confirmation dialogue for deleting. * Allow multi-select and delete from the "all media" screen.

link_counts.title: Allow deletion of media through preview. by greyson-signal · Pull Request #7522 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.name: Joshua Lund
posts.cooked: Deletion and batch deletion are now available in the media preview and media overview in Signal Android 4.18.

janvlug:

Safely installing Signal on the SDCard would also be a good option.

@janvlug and everybody else with limited internal storage problems: I opened an own topic for moving the app and data to SD-Card:

Allow installation on external storage location (SD-card) Android Feature Requests
Me - and I guess many other users with limited internal storage - would love to be able to install/move Signal on the phone’s SD-card. (…and subsequently have the heavy media-files there too) To allow the android system to install Signal on the external storage, you can include the android:installLocation attribute in the <manifest> element, with a value of ‘auto’. → see here Other popular apps that allow it are: Telegram, Instagram, Waze, OsmAnd, Trello, Riot.im… “Feature” was already twi…

link_counts.title: Allow installation on external storage location (SD-card)

posts.cooked:
jlund:

Deletion and batch deletion are now available in the media preview and media overview in Signal Android 4.18.

I can’t find batch deletion in the current version. Has it been removed again?
We also really need an “export all media” function.

posts.name: Joshua Lund
posts.cooked:
1. Open Signal.
  2. Go to any conversation.
  3. Tap the top header to access the conversation settings.
  4. Tap on “Shared media” to access the gallery view.
  5. Long-press on any picture to select it. Tap multiple images to select additional pictures.
  6. Tap on the delete icon in the top-right corner.

Thanks! It would be nice to have “export all media” and a “delete all media” menu entries, without having to select anything. They would make reducing Signal’s memory usage much more comfortable.
There is already a feature request:

Signal Community – 19 Apr 18

Feature request: batch media export to file system

It is great that media deletion is way more easy in the latest released version of Signal Android. Unfortunately, the batch media export functionality that was previously part of Signal Android disappeared, which makes it still a labour intensive...

Reading time: 1 mins 🕑 Likes: 31 ❤

link_counts.title: Feature request: batch media export to file system - Android Feature Requests - Signal Community

posts.cooked:
Long time ago @FeuRenard created some PRs dealing with this, and about a month ago these were created once again (rebased on master):

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Allow selecting all media in overview

signalapp:master ← FeuRenard:select-all-media
opened 05:43PM - 18 Jul 18 UTC
FeuRenard
+23 -0

### Contributor checklist - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](ht…tps://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices: * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) ---------- ### Description This change allows selecting all media in the media overview section. You can do so by long-pressing one item and then tap the select-all icon in the action bar. This feature allows deleting all media of a conversation at once, e.g. to free some disk space. With a save button in the media overview one could export those media in advance. ### Screenshot ![bildschirmfoto vom 2018-07-18 19-29-22](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16167751/42897949-fbd8e6b8-8ac1-11e8-9481-cee609da1f79.png)

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Allow batch saving of media

signalapp:master ← FeuRenard:batch-save
opened 06:46PM - 18 Jul 18 UTC
FeuRenard
+60 -0

### Contributor checklist - [x] I am following the [Code Style Guidelines](ht…tps://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Code-Style-Guidelines) - [x] I have tested my contribution on these devices: * AVD Nexus 5X, Android 7.1.1 - [x] My contribution is fully baked and ready to be merged as is - [x] I ensure that all the open issues my contribution fixes are mentioned in the commit message of my first commit using the `Fixes #1234` [syntax](https://help.github.com/articles/closing-issues-via-commit-messages/) ---------- ### Description This change allows selecting an arbitrary number of media items in media overview and then saving them to the phone's storage. Most of the code is just a restoration of the code which was removed [here](https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/commit/020e5b22ebff279c40773b2bd64b570030c9c81f#diff-978497c8da0623480ac14da5b105d5fbL124).

I don’t get why these and other contributions still haven’t been merged all the years… I guess because of reasons.

EDIT: Sorry, I just saw these PRs were already linked in the post referenced above.

link_counts.title: Allow selecting all media in overview by FeuRenard · Pull Request #7995 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub
Allow batch saving of media by FeuRenard · Pull Request #7996 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.name: Joshua Lund
posts.cooked:
PiCob:

I don’t get why these and other contributions still haven’t been merged all the years… I guess because of reasons.

We’re still a small organization (and we are still hiring). Every pull request needs to be reviewed very carefully, and sometimes we have to make difficult decisions about where to allocate our time in order to maximize impact.

@FeuRenard alone has had more than 40 commits merged into the Signal Android repository in just under the last two years. These contributions are highly appreciated by the developers and the user community, and hopefully we will be able to speed up the review feedback cycle as more full-time employees join the team.

Thanks for your patience and understanding!

link_counts.title: Signal >> Jobs

posts.cooked:
jlund:

We’re still a small organization (and we are still hiring). Every pull request needs to be reviewed very carefully, and sometimes we have to make difficult decisions about where to allocate our time in order to maximize impact.

Sure, I’m aware of that. But it’s more exactly these decisions, that I don’t understand sometimes. Look, the PR for multi-select includes such a small change set (just a few lines), isn’t risky and has a huge impact for users (this is why it’s a basic/essential feature in nearly every selection dialog on most OS’s)… Don’t get me wrong, I’m in no position to claim certain features, of course. I just wanted to mention that I don’t understand the prioritisation sometimes. It’s not that I didn’t appreciate all the work put in Signal.

EDIT: Sorry for the expression “because of reasons” - should’ve been “[…] the known reasons” referring to the ones you stated above - at least that’s what I meant it to be.

Hooray!

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Comment by greyson-signal to Allow selecting all media in overview

signalapp:master ← FeuRenard:select-all-media

Thank you for writing this! It's been merged into the 4.27 branch.

But please be aware that associated texts are still being deleted as well, see Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message

link_counts.title: Media deletion: Keep message text / don't delete whole message
Allow selecting all media in overview by FeuRenard · Pull Request #7995 · signalapp/Signal-Android · GitHub

posts.cooked:
This is handled in the upcoming Signal Android 4.51 release. The disk usage dashboard aggregates all media you have across all conversations (sortable by size) and lets you delete them from the dashboard

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 4.51 release Android Beta Feedback
We’re releasing the Signal 4.51 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here . Share your feedback on the latest changes: ★ Look for the disk usage dashboard in your Signal Settings under “Data and Storage.” Sort by type, size, or time in this new interface to spot a place that you can erase to free up more space. ★ Easily start a video call with a new shortcut that’s a more visible way to be visible. Complete list of new commits since 4.50.6 https://github.com…

★ Look for the disk usage dashboard in your Signal Settings under “Data and Storage.” Sort by type, size, or time in this new interface to spot a place that you can erase to free up more space.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 4.51 release

posts.cooked: You should, however, point out, that the current implementation of media deletion still removes the associated message (including its text) as well (see post above).
